intro: Calamus womersleyi, commonly known as the Womersley's screw-pine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Pandanaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and long, narrow leaves that are often spirally arranged. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences at the tips of the stems. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, coastal environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitats.
